item.title: Creative Commons 4.0
item.description:
Creative Commons has released version 4.0 of its sharing-friendly licenses for creative works. As of today, all of my music releases here are available under the new license.

Unfortunately, work and school are leaving me with little time for music these days, but that EP is happening eventually…

item.title: November updates
item.description:
I've implemented a commenting system for news and releases, so you can now easily give feedback! :)

It's been over a year since I last released anything, but I am currently putting together an EP with various old and new tracks. Stay tuned...

item.title: Foldplop article and new home
item.description:
Reid Bridgeman wrote a nice article about me in the Skagit Valley College Cardinal newspaper (page 9)! :) Here's a screenshot for those who can't view PDF files. Thanks, Reid!

item.title: Foldplop - Lambda Fantasy on my new YouTube channel
item.description:
I set up a new YouTube channel that I'm going to devote to music. I moved the old Timelines video there and made one for Lambda Fantasy!

Both of these are relatively simple Quartz Composer visualizations with no narrative. One of these days I hope I'll find the time to make a proper video...

item.title: I love Web 2.0 buttons!
item.description:
Not really, but I decided to add a few at the bottom of the page anyway:

  • RSS button for the feed that's been around since the introduction of the new site, to give it a bit more visibility.
  • A link to my Last.fm profile, if you want to see what kind of music I listen to.
  • A Flattr button. Flattr is a fairly new microdonation system where you allocate a monthly sum of money to donate and it gets spread out amongst people whose Flattr buttons you click. It's the coolest donation system concept I've come across, so I decided to give it a try. If you like my music and want to support me financially, you can now Flattr me! :)

item.title: The new site is live!
item.description:
As you can see, the new version of the Foldplop website is now up and running! There are still some back-end things I need to fix, but it is usable at least.

I will be adding a comment system later to encourage feedback. :) In the meantime, you can still e-mail me if you have something to say -- the address is foldplop at foldplop dot com.
